description: Safeguarding Food Security and Livelihoods Through Emergency Control of Peste des Petit Ruminants (PPR)

subproject.description:
The overall goal and long term outcome of the project is to safeguard food security and livelihoods of pastoralists and agro-pastoralists in Kenya through the emergency control of Peste des Petit Ruminants (PPR) outbreak in sheep and goats in three districts ( Laikipia, Samburu and Isiolo)  
This will be achieved by preventing further spread of the disease through protecting animals in 3 districts neighbouring infected areas (which are for the purposes of this document referred as the buffer) .  The project will support activities to conduct risk assessment and surveillance in the 3 buffer districts, procurement and administration of vaccines, capacity building and public awareness to the communities and staff.
The immediate outputs include: 1) Baseline data on flock immunity and prevalence levels established 2) Sheep and goats in 3 buffer districts protected against PPR    3) knowledge of Communities and local staff enhanced 4) Effectiveness and impact of vaccination established
